Players may burn the pie while baking one, resulting in a burnt pie; the burn rate while cooking these will decrease as players reach higher Cooking levels. Even at level 99, they still have a chance to burn, unless the player is wearing a Cooking cape. Alternatively, casting the Bake Pie spell from the lunar spellbook guarantees successful baking of all pies. Baking a wild pie at the Nardah clay oven is a requirement for the Elite Desert Diary.

SMW Subobject for HalfHigh Alchemy value: 54Examine: A triumph of man over nature.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Wild pieUses infobox: ItemImage: File:Half a wild pie.pngWeight: 0.001Value: 91Version anchor: HalfRelease date: 20 February 2006Item ID: 7210

Wild pies are a type of pie that can be obtained by baking a raw wild pie on a cooking range, requiring level 85 Cooking and granting 240 experience when successful. Players may burn the pie while baking one, resulting in a burnt pie; the burn rate while cooking these will decrease as players reach higher Cooking levels. Even at level 99, they still have a chance to burn, unless the player is wearing a Cooking cape. Alternatively, casting the Bake Pie spell from the lunar spellbook guarantees successful baking of all pies. Baking a wild pie at the Nardah clay oven is a requirement for the Elite Desert Diary.

Wild pie heals 22 hitpoints in total, 2 bites each healing 11, and grants a temporary skill boost to Slayer by 5 levels and Ranged by 4 levels. After eating it, a pie dish will remain.

The Slayer boost can be used to kill higher level Slayer monsters, but will need to reboosted if the player's Slayer level goes below the requirement. It is recommended to only use when 2 or 3 levels away from the requirement to avoid needing to eat more pie. The boost does not enable you to receive a slayer task from a slayer master above your level.

Wild pies are popular for fighting the Chaos Elemental or Chaos Fanatic because they heal a lot and when finished leave an item behind. An empty pie dish prevents them from un-equipping Worn Equipment due to a full inventory.

Contents

Creation[edit | edit source]

Requirements
SkillLevelXP
Cooking85 (b)240

Materials
ItemQuantityCost
Raw wild pie13,871
Total Cost3,871
Wild pie1704
Profit−3,167
  1. ↑ The ticks increase to 4 when using the Make-X functionality.
Steps
1. Use pastry dough on a pie dish to make a pie shell
2. Use a raw bear meat on the pie shell to make a part wild pie (raw bear meat)
3. Use a raw chompy on the part wild pie (raw bear meat) to make a part wild pie (raw chompy)
4. Use a raw rabbit on the part wild pie (raw chompy) to make a raw wild pie
5. Cook the raw wild pie on a range to finish a wild pie

'''Wild pies''' are a type of [[pie]] that can be obtained by baking a [[raw wild pie]] on a [[cooking range]], requiring level 85 [[Cooking]] and granting 240 experience when successful. Players may burn the pie while baking one, resulting in a [[burnt pie]]; the [[burn rate]] while cooking these will decrease as players reach higher Cooking levels. Even at level 99, they still have a chance to burn, unless the player is wearing a [[Cooking cape]]. Alternatively, casting the [[Bake Pie]] spell from the [[lunar spellbook]] guarantees successful baking of all pies. Baking a wild pie at the [[Nardah]] clay oven is a requirement for the [[Elite Desert Diary]].

Wild pie heals 22 [[hitpoints]] in total, 2 bites each healing 11, and grants a [[temporary skill boost]] to [[Slayer]] by 5 levels and [[Ranged]] by 4 levels. After eating it, a [[pie dish]] will remain.

The Slayer boost can be used to kill higher level Slayer monsters, but will need to reboosted if the player's Slayer level goes below the requirement. It is recommended to only use when 2 or 3 levels away from the requirement to avoid needing to eat more pie. The boost '''does not''' enable you to receive a [[slayer task]] from a [[slayer master]] above your level.

Wild pies are popular for fighting the [[Chaos Elemental]] or [[Chaos Fanatic]] because they heal a lot and when finished leave an item behind. An empty [[pie dish]] prevents them from un-equipping [[Worn Equipment]] due to a full inventory.
